dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2915 IH: Female Veteran Suicide Prevention Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to identify mental health care and suicide prevention programs and metrics that are effective in treating women veterans as part of the evaluation of such programs by the Secretary.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Female Veteran Suicide Prevention Act.

section.header: Specific consideration of women veterans in evaluation of Department of Veterans Affairs mental health care and suicide prevention programs
section.text: Section 1709B(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting before the semicolon the following: , including specific metrics applicable to women;
in subparagraph (D), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: identify the mental health care and suicide prevention programs conducted by the Secretary that are most effective for women veterans and such programs with the highest satisfaction rates among women veterans.
